The Digital Curation program is a one- to two-year graduate certificate, taught online, intended for folks working in museums, archives, labs, studios, government offices, and anywhere that people need to manage digital files. The program walks students through the phases of managing digitized or born-digital artifacts, including acquisition, representation, access, and preservation. https://DigitalCuration.UMaine.edu

column8: Curator, researcher and museum professional specialising in contemporary art / media art / science / technology / data / interdisciplinary and collaborative practice. Twenty-eight years' working with museums & galleries, 17 as full-time insider, 9 as an independent curator. I also work with a large number of non-art organisations who want to commission artists. Alongside my independent practice I am an Associate at the Open Data Institute (ODI) in London, where I direct the Data as Culture art programme. Care about social, climate & neurodiversity justice.
